quote: U-Net is the predominant approach to medical image segmentation task.
The encoder follows the typical architecture of a convolutional network, which is used to extract spatial features from the images.
In the U-Net architecture, after each pooling and transposed convolutional layer, a sequence of two 3 × 3 convolutional layers, which can be considered as a 5 × 5 convolution, is applied.

The U-Net has been a remarkable and the most popular architecture in medical image segmentation and the MultiResUNet can provide a much better output than the U-Net, because it can provide different scales features.
To apply this inception-like block makes U-Net architecture have the ability to concatenate features learnt from the image at different scales.
From these experiments, DC-UNet shows great potential in multimodal medical image segmentation.
DC-UNet seems more reliable and robust. DC-UNet can detect vague boundaries and avoid the interference of noise.
Therefore, we believed that the DC-UNet architecture can be an effective model for medical image segmentation.
U-net: Convolutional networks for biomedical image segmentation.
